Problem:

If the Fourier Transform \\( \\mathcal{F}(z(t)) \\) is calculated without any additional manipulation of \\( z(t) \\), will the transform adequately capture all the frequency components inherent in \\( z(t) \\)?
Explanation: The Fourier Transform is designed to deconstruct a signal into its constituent frequency components, handling both real and imaginary parts, thus capturing the complete frequency spectrum of \\( z(t) \\).
